conclusion: To determine the refractive index of water, use the concept of the critical angle in total internal reflection.
The critical angle is the angle of incidence above which total internal reflection occurs.

Total internal reflection occurs when light travels from a medium with a higher refractive index to a medium with a lower refractive index if the angle of incidence is greater than the critical angle.
The angle α is the angle between the laser beam and the water surface.
The laser beam is only received by the shore rescuers when α > 41°, implying the critical angle θc is 90° - 41° = 49°.
The critical angle θc is related to the refractive indices of the two media by the equation sin(θc) = 1/n.
Substitute θc = 49° into the equation sin(49°) = 1/n.
The refractive index of water is approximately 1.33.
